ratings.comment: His lectures were very hard to follow. The exams reflected content we had barely even focused on. Once I went into office hours for help and he was pretty much unable to understand my question and give me the help I needed. I would not recommend this professor.

Leith was visibly uncomfortable in the large lecture hall, and used the words "essentially" and "fundamentally" to the point that it was difficult to understand his lectures. He over-explains simple concepts then skims over what the class is struggling with. Leith needs more confidence and preparation for class in order to be a good professor.

Exams are ridiculously more difficult than the material he covers in lecture, and there is no good way to prepare. Consequently, class is skewed towards those with prior knowledge. Exam questions are confusing and riddled with mistakes. He is also very petty, and makes exams questions more difficult when he feels disrespected by the class.

He was terrible. So awkward all the time, it got to the point where I learned less by actually going to lecture. He was so behind on lectures and the tests covered materials that we didnt even learn! I would recommend switching or dropping if you see that you have him.

If you are looking for an experienced teacher who clearly defines what is expected of you and is a solid lecturer DO NOT TAKE CHEM 104 with Samad. He brushes over important concepts but spends time on irrelevant material (once spent 5 min explaining that the hw due date would be switched).

The only good thing about this class was its curve. Generally, Leith Samad should not be a lecturer. He knows the materials well, but has a hard time presenting it well. He is very redundant and reiterates things that does not need to be. We often got behind on lectures, and many students did not take him seriously.

Leith isn't a bad person just a bad lecturer. He struggles to spit his words out and repeats the same things over and over again and uses so many filler words, he once said "essentially" 107 times in one lecture. This all leads to a very boring lecture that isn't always easy to follow as key points often fail to come across. Not the worst though.
He doesnt teach everything that is scheduled. We were behind every lesson and never learned everything on time. Also he doesnt explain everything fully.

His inexperience as a prof shows. Can't hate the guy for trying to do his job even though I really want to. Worst prof-student dynamic i've ever seen and his lectures put me to sleep. Honestly think he would to better teaching a higher level class with a smaller lecture with people who actually care about chem. Also says essentially way too much...

He doesn't give an accurate idea of what the exams will be like. Isnt able to maintain attention during class and makes things more confusing when he explains concepts. He gave us an extremely difficult first exam and included concepts we hadn't gone over because we "didnt respect him". Would not take again.

Struggles with getting his point across in a concise manner. Very nervous lecturer: the majority of his lecture is just him stammering and using filler words. Spends 5 minutes covering TopHat questions that 95% of the class got right then falls behind and doesn't cover the harder material well enough. Don't expect to learn much in lecture.

Very little experience teaching. He tends to explain the same thing over and over in consecutive sentences. Nervous speaker (one lecture we counted him using the word "essentially" 81 times and "fundamentally" 43 times, all in a 50 min lecture. The free response portion of his exams are very challenging.
Ehhhhhhh. Not good.

It is quite clear that Leith has little experience lecturing to a large number of students. He struggles to maintain control of the class, and often speaks nervously and without certainty. With that said, he is very friendly and his exams are manageable if you devote some time outside of class to studying.

Tests include questions completely unlike examples gone over in class and are nothing like the practice exams. The grading system/rubric for tests isn't shown to students so for minor errors you can lose half the points and have no idea why. Spent more time counting how many times he uses the word essentially rather than being able to learn content

Not a respectable professor. He spends most of his lectures on useless topics that you'll never see again and his tests have literally nothing to do with anything he covered in class or put on the practice exam. His exams also have super specific grading criteria that he never bothers to cover so you basically can't ever get full credit on an exam

No drama here. As an educator, Leith isn't bad. He engages with the class during TopHat questions and wants you to understand the content. However, because of these things, he tends to overexploit topics and spend too much time on TopHat, making the class fall behind on content. His exams make you to use what you know to answer unfamiliar problems.

Leith Samad spends too much time on tophat questions and topics that are not important, while spending little to no time on key concepts. Despite this, I still know a great deal of what we are learning, which doesn't matter, since his tests have nothing to do with what we learn in class. I am very disappointed.

Very redundant and boring lectures. Covers easy material for far longer than anyone needs and then runs out of time before teaching the more difficult material. Hopefully he will improve as he continues to teach but as of now, not a good instructor.

His tests are impossible to take, they average around a 50%. He isnt helpful at all at office hours or in emails if you have questions. He falls far behind and doesnt give you the right info you need for the exam, he talks about irrelevant things for the whole lecture that you wont ever need to know. He is the worst educator Ive ever had.

Switch Professors if you get him. He has little experience and it shows. He struggles to keep up with the content without falling massively behind. His quizzes and exams are mostly tough to get through.

His tests are extremely difficult compared to any practice done beforehand. He's a very nervous lecturer and spends way too much lecture time going into depth about things that aren't relevant. The weekly quizzes are either easy or impossible. Help yourself out and take a more experienced professor.

He doesn't know how to time out his lectures and somehow falls multiple lectures behind the other professors. He spends WAY too much time explaining things that don't need that much explanation. It seems like he purposely makes his exams way harder than his sample questions in order to "punish" his classes for talking too much. Aka SWITCH CLASSES!!

Samad was very nervous and it was obvious that this was his first course. He was not helpful when I attended office hours and graded textbook homework really hard. Invest in the solutions guide. The exams are much easier than the homework/practice exams. If you read the text book and make sure you understand the pre lab before lab you will be fine.

Very nervous professor, would not recommend. Read the textbook and do the assigned homework ahead of time then go to office hours. Leith is not super insightful so I visited the TA office frequently. Make sure to do all of the prelab to gain full credit!
